alert.note: Alert for Barton; Ellsworth; Lincoln; Rice; Russell (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued March 29 at 3:05PM CDT until March 29 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM TO 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph will develop this afternoon with gusts up to 70 mph peaking during the afternoon hours. * WHERE...Russell, Lincoln, Barton, Ellsworth and Rice Counties. * WHEN...The strongest winds are expected during the mid to late afternoon hours. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strong winds are likely to pick up blowing dust creating lower visibilities. This will create additional hazards while driving on highways. Slow down in blowing dust conditions.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.
